title: Rust thinks there is a semicolon but it's a function's closing bracket

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.

If you cannot produce a minimal reproduction case (something that would work in
isolation), please provide the steps or even link to a repository that causes
the problematic output to occur. 
-->

When I came across https://doc.rust-lang.org/stable/rust-by-example/fn/closures/output_parameters.html I learned that when I want to return a closure from a function, I need to annotate its return type as `impl Fn()`. Then out of curiousity I tried to replace the closure with a function definition, so this is what I did:
Given the following code: (https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=6f6c140df20f1041d4bfccc3d162ef84)

```rust
fn a() -> impl Fn() {
    fn b() { }
}
```

The current output is:

```
error[E0277]: expected a `Fn<()>` closure, found `()`
 --> src/lib.rs:1:11
  |
1 | fn a() -> impl Fn() {
  |           ^^^^^^^^^ expected an `Fn<()>` closure, found `()`
2 |     fn b() { }
  |              - consider removing this semicolon
  |
  = help: the trait `Fn<()>` is not implemented for `()`
  = note: wrap the `()` in a closure with no arguments: `|| { /* code */ }`

error: aborting due to previous error

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0277`.
error: could not compile `playground`

To learn more, run the command again with --verbose.
```
Notice this confusing line:
```
  |              - consider removing this semicolon
```
There is no semicolon.

<!-- The following is not always necessary. -->
Maybe the output should look something like this? Not sure about the message below the closing curly bracket.

```
error[E0277]: expected a `Fn<()>` closure, found `()`
 --> src/lib.rs:1:11
  |
1 | fn a() -> impl Fn() {
  |           ^^^^^^^^^ expected an `Fn<()>` closure, found `()`
2 |     fn b() { }
  |           
  = help: the trait `Fn<()>` is not implemented for `()`
  = note: wrap the `()` in a closure with no arguments: `|| { /* code */ }`

error: aborting due to previous error

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0277`.
error: could not compile `playground`

To learn more, run the command again with --verbose.
```

<!--
If the problem is not self-explanatory, please provide a rationale for the
change.
-->

<!--
If dramatically different output is caused by small changes, consider also
adding them here.

If you're using the stable version of the compiler, you should also check if the
bug also exists in the beta or nightly versions. The output might also be
different depending on the Edition.
-->
